channel.title: Indian Premier League, 2017 news from ESPN Cricinfo.com
channel.description: Visit Cricinfo.com for up-to-the-minute cricket news, breaking cricket news, live cricket commentary, ball-by-ball commentary, cricket video, cricket audio and features.

image.title: Indian Premier League, 2017 news from ESPN Cricinfo.com

item.title: A special day in my life - Samson
item.description: After scoring his maiden T20 century to help Delhi Daredevils record their biggest win in the IPL, Sanju Samson was very pleased he was able to do "something special"

item.title: Bowling yorkers easy to say, not to bowl - Nehra
item.description: Ashish Nehra emphasised on the importance of mental toughness to bowl during the end overs of a T20, but said bowling yorkers isn't an easy art

item.title: Samson's maiden ton razes Rising Pune
item.description: A maiden T20 hundred from Sanju Samson and a blistering unbeaten 38, off just nine balls, from Chris Morris, led Delhi Daredevils to their first win of the season, a 97-run mauling of Rising Pune Supergiant

item.title: Sunrisers gear up to unleash Mustafizur-Rashid combo
item.description: Sunrisers Hyderabad will be forced to rethink a settled combination with the return of Mustafizur Rahman, as they take on a charged-up Mumbai Indians at the Wankhede

item.title: Chris Lynn's IPL prospects not looking good
item.description: Kolkata Knight Riders opener Chris Lynn appears increasingly likely to miss the remainder of the IPL after he hurt his shoulder while fielding against Mumbai Indians

item.title: Back my strength to swing the ball - Sandeep
item.description: Sandeep Sharma has said he likes to stick to his plans and does not worry too much about leaking runs in the death overs

item.title: Kings XI overcome de Villiers' one-man show
item.description: AB de Villiers made a jaw-dropping 89 off 46 balls, but the rest of Royal Challengers Bangalore was so woeful that Kings XI Punjab won with 33 balls to spare

item.title: Tahir key against team that released him
item.description: Rising Pune Supergiant won both their games against Delhi Daredevils last season. Can they keep that form going?

item.title: Lynn's IPL under cloud after shoulder injury
item.description: The injury in the match against Mumbai Indians on Sunday was the third injury to the same shoulder in less than two years

item.title: Lions might rethink overseas strategy - Brad Hodge
item.description: That Gujarat Lions have managed to take only one wicket in two games has prompted the management to rethink their strategy of playing four overseas batsmen

item.title: Gayle chases landmark against favourite opponents
item.description: Chris Gayle is 25 short of 10,000 T20 runs ahead of Royal Challengers Bangalore's meeting with Kings XI Punjab in Indore

item.title: Rana, Pandya brothers stage stunning heist
item.description: On a high-scoring, field-first ground, fighting considerable amount of dew, Kolkata Knight Riders nearly won with an under-par 178 but failed to defend 59 in the last 23 balls

item.title: Warner, Rashid give Lions a thrashing
item.description: Rashid Khan and David Warner combined to ease Sunrisers Hyderabad to their second win of the season, and send Gujarat Lions crashing to another huge defeat

item.title: Fitness has transformed my game - Jadhav
item.description: Kedar Jadhav, whose 37-ball 69 led Royal Challengers to their first win in the IPL this season, said he has always aimed to be a match-winner for his side

item.title: Under-pressure Lions face their bogey team
item.description: Sunrisers Hyderabad have won all three of their matches against Gujarat Lions and will want to keep that momentum going

item.title: Royal Challengers defend 157 despite Pant's belligerence
item.description: Royal Challengers Bangalore defended 157 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium against Delhi Daredevils to register their first win of the tournament

item.title: Mumbai gain Malinga but lose Rayudu
item.description: The arrival of Lasith Malinga for Mumbai Indians and Shakib Al Hasan for Kolkata Knight Riders highlights the high-profile match between the two teams on Sunday

item.title: Bowlers' strangle, Maxwell flash gives Kings XI success
item.description: The Kings XI Punjab bowlers restricted Rising Pune Supergiants to a total of 163 which Glenn Maxwell, on captaincy debut, helped overhaul with an over to spare

item.title: 'It's as simple as see ball, hit ball' - Lynn
item.description: Chris Lynn has said he stuck to the basics and focused on putting the bad balls away during his unbeaten 93 off 41 balls in the record opening stand with Gautam Gambhir

item.title: Gambhir, Lynn blaze away in record chase
item.description: Kolkata Knight Riders gunned down a target of 184 without losing a single wicket - a world record in T20 cricket

item.title: Maxwell readies for captaincy debut, against Smith
item.description: Kings XI Punjab, who finished bottom of the table last season, will be hoping to do much better this time around, under their new captain

item.title: RCB look to avoid slide against bowling-heavy Daredevils
item.description: Both sides will miss key players as Delhi Daredevils aim to start their IPL campaign with a win while Royal Challengers Bangalore look to avoid losing the plot before the return of Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers

item.title: Dhoni reprimanded for DRS gesture
item.description: MS Dhoni has been reprimanded for a "minor" code of conduct breach after Rising Pune Supergiant's seven-wicket win in their opening match against Mumbai Indians

item.title: Tahir bounces back after going unsold at auction
item.description: Imran Tahir, who went unsold at the IPL auction in February, has said how special it was to pick three early wickets to set up Rising Pune Supergiant's win against Mumbai Indians

item.title: Daredevils sign Hilfenhaus to replace Duminy
item.description: Other new entries in the IPL include Vishnu Vinod for Royal Challengers Bangalore and Washington Sundar for Rising Pune Supergiant

item.title: KKR, Lions bank on big batting line-ups
item.description: Much of the success of Gujarat Lions and Kolkata Knight Riders is because of the performances of their batsmen at Nos. 1 to 4

item.title: De Villiers doubtful for next RCB game too, says no to keeping
item.description: AB de Villiers, who missed the IPL 2017 season opener with a back injury, is a doubtful starter for Royal Challengers' second match as well

item.title: Rahane, Smith clinch thriller for Pune
item.description: An ice-cool unbeaten 84 from Steven Smith steered Rising Pune Supergiant to a seven-wicket win against Mumbai Indians at the MCA Stadium

item.title: India comeback has helped me play more freely - Yuvraj
item.description: Sunrisers Hyderabad captain David Warner, too, praised Yuvraj Singh, saying if Yuvraj repeated his effort "five or six times" then the defending champions could go a very long way in the IPL

item.title: Yuvraj's blitz proves too much for RCB
item.description: In the repeat of the 2016 final, Sunrisers Hyderabad followed a similar winning script, scoring 200-plus and defending it after an early scare

item.title: Smith seeks winning start at venue of Test success
item.description: In February, Steven Smith led Australia to a famous Test win in Pune. Now, he returns to the city as Rising Pune Supergiant's new captain

item.title: Kings XI replace injured Vijay with Ishant
item.description: Kings XI Punjab have added Ishant Sharma to their pace-heavy attack ahead of the tenth season of IPL, as a replacement for M Vijay

item.title: Not easy to emulate 2016 campaign - Williamson
item.description: The New Zealand captain, who has played only eight IPL games over the past two years, said that it was important the new-look Sunrisers team gelled well if they are to have any chance of a title defence

item.title: Depleted challengers take on defending champions in season opener
item.description: Without Virat Kohli, AB de Villiers and KL Rahul, can RCB challenge Sunrisers Hyderabad on their home turf?

item.title: Shreyas Iyer out with chickenpox
item.description: Delhi Daredevils batsman Shreyas Iyer has been ruled out for at least a week with a bout of chickenpox

item.title: Top-heavy Lions look to outdo debut success
item.description: Lions have an enviable top order once again, but the bowling attack appears thin, especially considering the absence of the injured Ravindra Jadeja and Dwayne Bravo from the first few matches

item.title: First-XI form concerns for Mumbai Indians
item.description: Though Rohit Sharma, Jos Buttler, Lasith Malinga and Kieron Pollard come into the IPL fit and ready, they don't quite have their usual weight of runs and wickets behind them

item.title: Watson to stand in as Royal Challengers captain
item.description: In the absence of Virat Kohli and with AB de Villiers ruled out of the season opener on April 5, the Australian allrounder Shane Watson has been named interim captain of Royal Challengers Bangalore

item.title: Knight Riders replace Russell with de Grandhomme
item.description: Kolkata Knight Riders have taken on New Zealand allrounder Colin de Grandhomme, who has a strike-rate of 171 from 91 innings in all T20 cricket

item.title: Coach Jayawardene excited by Mumbai's riches
item.description: Mahela Jayawardene hopes to bring his vast T20 experience as a freelance cricketer to the fore in his first full-fledged stint as head coach with Mumbai Indians

item.title: I was scared by the injury - Rohit
item.description: Rohit Sharma said it was mentally tough to sit out due to injury, but said he didn't want to get frustrated and do "unnecessary or unwanted things" during a lengthy rehabilitation process

item.title: All-star Supergiant seek winning formula
item.description: They have a squad studded with the biggest names, but they will need to do much more than they did last year if they are to declare their season a success

item.title: Mathews out of Bangladesh T20s, unlikely for IPL's start
item.description: Angelo Mathews will miss the T20s against Bangladesh next week, and is also unlikely to be fit for the start of the IPL, SLC cricket manager Asanka Gurusinha has confirmed

item.title: Zaheer keen to embrace 'support role'
item.description: Zaheer Khan hopes a revitalised pace bowling attack, that has in its ranks new recruits Pat Cummins and Kagiso Rabada, will help him play the role of a support cast and not the bowling lead

item.title: Ashwin to give IPL a miss, Vijay doubtful
item.description: The offspinner will be out of action for six to eight weeks, but is expected to regain full fitness ahead of India's title defence at the Champions Trophy in June

item.title: Shoulder injury sidelines Rahul from IPL
item.description: Royal Challengers Bangalore batsman KL Rahul is expected to have surgery to his left shoulder and will miss the 10th edition of the IPL due to begin on April 5

item.title: De Villiers to lead RCB if Kohli unavailable
item.description: AB de Villiers will lead Royal Challengers Bangalore if Virat Kohli fails to recover, from his shoulder injury, in time for the start of the IPL

item.title: Daredevils coach Dravid rues loss of de Kock to injury
item.description: Delhi Daredevils coach Rahul Dravid has said missing a batsman of Quinton de Kock's calibre as well as the experience of JP Duminy will affect the balance and composition of the team going into tenth edition of the IPL

item.title: Virat Kohli in doubt for start of IPL
item.description: Royal Challengers Bangalore might have to start IPL 2017 without their captain Virat Kohli, as he battles against time to recover from a shoulder injury

item.title: Pune sign Tahir for injured Mitchell Marsh
item.description: Imran Tahir is set to turn up for a second IPL franchise - the Rising Pune Supergiant - after being signed as a replacement for the injured Australian allrounder Mitchell Marsh

item.title: De Kock under cloud for Hamilton Test, IPL
item.description: Quinton de Kock is in doubt for the Hamilton Test and may also miss the IPL due to tendon damage to his right index finger

item.title: Duminy pulls out of IPL due to personal reasons
item.description: South Africa and Delhi Daredevils allrounder JP Duminy has withdrawn himself from the tenth season of the IPL, citing "personal" reasons

item.title: Mills stays level-headed as IPL venture nears
item.description: Tymal Mills says that he will not believe he is a newly-minted IPL millionaire until his £1.4 million fee from Bangalore Royal Challengers has landed in his account

item.title: Injured Mitchell Marsh almost certainly out of IPL
item.description: A left shoulder injury to Australia allrounder Mitchell Marsh has led to him potentially missing the next nine months of cricket

item.title: Maxwell named Kings XI Punjab captain
item.description: The Australian allrounder takes over the role from M Vijay, who was appointed captain midway through the last season

item.title: Shardul Thakur joins Rising Pune Supergiant
item.description: Rising Pune Supergiant have acquired seamer Shardul Thakur from Kings XI Punjab for the tenth season of the IPL, which starts on April 5

item.title: 'Two years ago I couldn't have dreamed of this' - Mills
item.description: Despite attracting a final bid of $1.8 million, a staggering 24 times his original base price, Tymal Mills is remaining admirably calm

item.title: Stokes, Woakes, Buttler to miss Ireland ODIs
item.description: Ben Stokes will be available to his new IPL franchise, Rising Pune Supergiants, for the full six-week group stage of the competition

item.title: Going to IPL for the experience, not the money - Boult
item.description: The New Zealand left-arm pacer will be one of the premier fast bowlers on display at the IPL this season after Kolkata Knight Riders bought him for INR 5 crore

item.title: 'Tears came into my eyes' - Nabi
item.description: Mohammad Nabi's successful bid in the IPL auction lit up the ACB headquarters in Kabul after the first two Afghan players had gone unsold in the auction in Bangalore

item.title: Stokes and Mills in shock after 'life-changing' IPL auction
item.description: Ben Stokes and Tymal Mills both recognise that their lives have been changed overnight, after being signed for record-breaking fees by Rising Pune Supergiants and Royal Challengers Bangalore respectively

item.title: 'IPL will encourage Rabada to raise his game'
item.description: International cricket will remain Kagiso Rabada's first priority even after a lucrative IPL deal, his father Mpho Rabada told ESPNcricinfo

item.title: Really surprised, really happy - Rashid
item.description: The 18-year-old Afghanistan legspinner was thrilled after his selection at the IPL auction, where Sunrisers Hyderabad bought him for INR 4 crore (USD 595,000 approx)

item.title: Stokes bought by Pune for $2.16 million
item.description: England allrounder Ben Stokes was bought for INR 14.5 crore ($2.16 million approx) by Rising Pune Supergiants at the tenth IPL player auction in Bangalore on Monday

item.title: List of players sold and unsold at IPL auction 2017
item.description: Which team bought which player? How the 2017 IPL auction panned out

item.title: RCB and Mitchell Starc part ways ahead of 2017 season
item.description: RCB will now go into the player auction in Bangalore with two slots for overseas players - they previously had only one - and an additional INR 5 crore in their purse

item.title: Smith replaces Dhoni as Pune Supergiants captain
item.description: MS Dhoni will not captain his IPL franchise Rising Pune Supergiants this season, with Steven Smith set to lead the team in the tournament that starts on April 5

item.title: Mohammad Kaif appointed assistant coach of Gujarat Lions
item.description: Former India batsman Mohammad Kaif has been named assistant coach of the Gujarat Lions for the 2017 IPL season

item.title: Indore returns as IPL venue, final in Hyderabad on May 21
item.description: Indore, which last hosted an IPL match in 2011, returns as one of the 10 venues for IPL 2017, which starts on April 5 when defending champions Sunrisers Hyderabad host Royal Challengers Bangalore

item.title: SA, England players likely to leave IPL early
item.description: With South Africa's tour of England beginning in mid-May, followed by the Champions Trophy, both boards are keen to make their players available and ready for the series

item.title: Six Associate players in final IPL auction list
item.description: More than 100 capped international players will be among the 351 players available for bidding at the upcoming IPL 2017 auction in Bangalore on February 20

item.title: J Arunkumar joins Kings XI's coaching staff
item.description: Karnataka coach J Arunkumar has been named Kings XI Punjab's batting coach for the 2017 IPL season

item.title: Stokes, Morgan, Woakes top attractions at IPL auction
item.description: England's Ben Stokes, Eoin Morgan and Chris Woakes are among seven players who have listed their prices as INR 2 crore in the upcoming auction for IPL 2017

item.title: IPL player auction set for February 20
item.description: The player auction ahead of the 2017 season of the IPL will be held on February 20 in Bangalore

item.title: Kevin Pietersen opts out of IPL 2017
item.description: Kevin Pietersen will not play the 2017 season of the IPL, citing a busy winter as a reason for not entering the player auction scheduled for later this month

item.title: 2017 IPL auction delayed until late February
item.description: The IPL 2017 auction date is close to being finalized for later this month in preparation for the tournament scheduled to begin on April 5
